revised_title: On the Normal Paraffins in Resinous Exudation from Pinus Sabiniana
tldr: This article discusses the results of an investigation into the composition of heptane found in the resinous exudation from Pinus Sabiniana. The authors, Schorlemmer and Thorpe, analyze the chemical properties of the heptane, including its conversion into chlorides, alcohols, and heptylene. Their findings provide further evidence of the behavior of normal paraffins when acted upon by chlorine.
